intro: Epicranthes hirudinifera, commonly known as the red sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in well-drained sandy soils. The plant produces small, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters, adding a striking visual contrast to its gray-green foliage. Its succulent leaves are adapted to store water, making it well-suited for drought conditions. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is occasionally cultivated in xeriscapic gardens.
